channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Strawberry neighbors still see red flags in seminary-site plan
item.description: Neighbors say the final EIR proves the project is too large — with one attorney threatening legal action if changes aren’t made.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Reed board wants more public input on $115M school bond
item.description: Survey results show approval is “viable” but far from a sure thing.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lavin

item.title: Belvedere agrees to pay $50k to settle lawsuit over construction time penalty
item.description: The $254,400 penalty remains final while the $50,000 represents new settlement consideration rather than a refund or reimbursement.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Hessel

item.title: Tiburon names new community development head
item.description: Shari Meads stepped into the role of community development director at Town Hall Dec. 8, taking over for Dina Tasini.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Point Tiburon Plaza coffee cart gets initial approval from town
item.description: The owners must provide more details on wastewater disposal, visual screening and operations before receiving formal approval.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Belvedere cuts deal to leave Artist’s View mostly untouched until 2043
item.description: The 2043 end date ties to a restriction placed on the property 57 years ago, when Feb. 20, 1968, deed imposed 75-year limits on its use and public access.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Reed schools line up new meal provider after vendor’s sudden exit
item.description: The announcement forced the district to scramble to secure a new vendor for the rest of the school year.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lavin

item.title: Member’s early exit opens seat on Reed school district board
item.description: The board has 60 days to decide whether to appoint someone to serve the remainder of her term or call for a special election.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lavin

item.title: Tiburon parks board urges higher visibility for street-sign art
item.description: Parks board: Think bigger and place them in more prominent locations around town.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A couple’s Tiburon day trip spurred by online posts
item.description: The couple had lunch Dec. 16 at Salt & Pepper on Main Street and planned to catch Cinelounge’s Tuesday weekly $5 “mystery movie."
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Neighbor rallies support for seniors at Kruger Pines
item.description: Randy Chase, a longtime political organizer and construction laborer who moved into Kruger Pines about six weeks ago, is launching an “Adopt-A-Senior” program.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez
